items.title: Feature request: the data range of axis -- X or/and Y can be changed dynamically

milestone.description: This is planned to be a significant milestone, featuring the ability to create custom "charts-within-charts" feature that can be used to make a variety of informative solutions. A significant part of this work is the ability to adapt even better on the client side to data changes, with automatically updating axes, color mappings and so one as an option for streaming data.

items.body:
There are two use cases from our team:
1. The Y values are calculated based on user inputs.
2. There are multiple charts which are on top of each other with different X range. We want to show the chart one at a time based at run time based on the selection of other controls.

items.title: D3Integration.createBrunelResult() Not thread safe?

milestone.description: A mix of bug fixes and some new feature

items.body:
I'm creating a spring boot application and I'm calling the createBrunelResult() function in my service implementation.
I'm essentially mimicking the code provided in the sample service:

try {
			if (prefix != null) brunelSrc = D3Integration.prefixAllDataStatements(brunelSrc, prefix);
			BrunelD3Result result = D3Integration.createBrunelResult(data, brunelSrc, width, height, visId, controlsId);
			return Response.ok(result).header("Access-Control-Allow-Origin", "*").build();
		} catch (Exception ex) {
			ex.printStackTrace();
			throw makeException(ex.getMessage(), ex, Status.BAD_REQUEST.getStatusCode(), false);
		}

When I make a call to this service using 20 threads concurrently I get many concurrentModification exceptions:

java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
	at java.util.ArrayList.sort(ArrayList.java:1456)
	at java.util.Collections.sort(Collections.java:141)
	at org.brunel.model.style.StyleSheet.ensureSorted(StyleSheet.java:92)
	at org.brunel.model.style.StyleSheet.get(StyleSheet.java:72)
	at org.brunel.model.style.StyleSheet.getBrunelDefault(StyleSheet.java:68)
	at org.brunel.build.util.ModelUtil.getStyle(ModelUtil.java:180)
	at org.brunel.build.util.ModelUtil.getSize(ModelUtil.java:58)
	at org.brunel.build.util.ModelUtil.getSize(ModelUtil.java:61)
	at org.brunel.build.element.ElementDimension.<init>(ElementDimension.java:38)
	at org.brunel.build.element.ElementDetails.<init>(ElementDetails.java:124)
	at org.brunel.build.element.ElementDetails.makeForCoordinates(ElementDetails.java:42)
	at org.brunel.build.info.ElementStructure.<init>(ElementStructure.java:58)
	at org.brunel.build.info.ChartStructure.<init>(ChartStructure.java:74)
	at org.brunel.build.ChartBuilder.build(ChartBuilder.java:70)
	at org.brunel.build.ChartBuilder.build(ChartBuilder.java:50)
	at org.brunel.build.VisualizationBuilder.buildTiledCharts(VisualizationBuilder.java:250)
	at org.brunel.build.VisualizationBuilder.build(VisualizationBuilder.java:109)
	at org.brunel.util.D3Integration.makeD3(D3Integration.java:168)
	at org.brunel.util.D3Integration.createBrunelResult(D3Integration.java:132)
	at com.truven.ote.api.service.impl.BrunelServiceImpl.getBrunelGraphJavascript(BrunelServiceImpl.java:45)
	at com.truven.ote.TestStrip$1.run(TestStrip.java:44)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

Is there a way this method could be accessing shared variables between threads? I am curious because when I make 20 calls to this method serially I get no errors. A simple fix would be to make this an instanced function instead of static.

https://github.com/Brunel-Visualization/Brunel/pull/266

items.title: Request: Invert color maps
items.body: Sometimes I'll want to use a color map (e.g. diverging) but I want the map reversed.  As a workaround I'm creating a new column with the values reversed or negated that I only use for the color attribute, but it'd be handy if something like ```color(c:diverging:reverse)``` were supported to avoid the need for this.  I don't see anything in the docs that lets one invert colors the way one can invert axes, sorts, etc.

items.title: Weighted edge aesthetic
items.body:
I really like the ability to visualize trees and graphs with Brunel, but don't see a way to style edges based on their weight.  My use case is to build something like this:

![tree graph](https://littleml.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/traditional.png)

Doesn't have to be as pretty -- just want the idea of paths through the graph/tree to be styled so it's obvious which edges have more weight.

items.title: Multi-level (nested) column support?
items.body: Is there a syntax for referencing nested column(s), e.g. those created by a Pandas pivot operation?  The Pandas syntax for referencing them is df[("foo", "bar")] but I don't know how to reference them in Brunel if I want to plot them.

items.title: "slice" support?

milestone.description: No major features planned, unless I get inspired and work on faceting

items.body: I find myself in need of something like ```top()``` and ```bottom()```, but supporting a kind of slice syntax.  E.g. the top 1-10 items is ```top(10)```, but what if I want the next 10 items (11-20)?  I was thinking either something like ```top(10:20)```, or perhaps something like ```slice(10:20:descending)``` to leave the current ```top()``` and ```bottom()``` operators unchanged.

items.title: snap doesn't work right on points
items.body:
Using the "Try it" site http://brunel.mybluemix.net/gallery_app/renderer, I ran this syntax:

data('sample:US States.csv') point x(abbr) y(population) interaction(call:'BrunelD3.crosshairs':mouseover:snapx:3:snapy:3)

I expected that when I got within 3px of any point (vertically or horizontally), I would see the crosshairs.  Instead what happens is whenever my mouse is within 3px of an imaginary vertical line crossing a point, I see crosshairs.

items.title: Snap should work with tooltips

milestone.description: No major features planned, unless I get inspired and work on faceting

items.body: I would like the snap feature to work with tooltips, something like this: `tooltip(#all):snap`.  This way if I have really small points, or really thin lines, I can still see the tooltips without much effort in getting the mouse to line up exactly over the point/line.

items.title: Support for languages with bidirectional scripts (i.e. Arabic / Hebrew)
items.body:
Publishing draft version of design document providing:
1. Essential information on basic Bidi requirements
2. End user perspective for suggested enhancements to Brunel
3. Insights into the implementation of each of Bidi requirements inside Brunel.

[Brunel_BidiSDD0_18June2017.pdf](https://github.com/Brunel-Visualization/Brunel/files/1083154/Brunel_BidiSDD0_18June2017.pdf)

@grahamwills and  @danrope please have a look and share your feedback. I would like to finalize the overall approach before submitting PRs with implementation. Many thanks in advance.

items.title: Feature request: consider missing values as valid values in Brunel range filter

milestone.description: Next interim release; the date is provisional

items.body:
Brunel range filter only supports "&&" operation. In some cases, we need both "&&" and "||". For example, I want the chart displayed with ( (value <= max) && (value >= min)) || (value == 0). Right now, there is no way to do it in Brunel.

With this new feature which is requrested here, we are set 0 as missing then my scenario above will work.

items.title: Word cloud visualization may change shape when the visualization is re-executed

milestone.description: Next interim release; the date is provisional

items.body:
The cloud visualization changes its presentation for the same set of words and weights: e.g. you click on a topic and get the corresponding cloud, click on another topic, and click on the first one again - the initial cloud visualization is not the same as the last one, but should be identical

Here is an example of the dashboard that may be used for testing this behavior (please select different topics on the primary chart and observe the changes in shape when returning to original topics):
%%brunel data('topicsContent') bar x(topic) y(weight) color(weight) sort(weight) sum(weight) tooltip(#all) interaction(select) | 
interaction(filter)  cloud color(weight) size(weight) sort(weight) label(word)  
:: width=800, height=500

items.title: Setting style affects the legend while defined for visualization
items.body:
Example:
%%brunel data('countsDataframe') cloud color(occurrence) size(occurrence) sort(occurrence)   label(word) style(':nth-child(odd) { font-family:Impact;font-style:normal') style(':nth-child(even) { font-family:Times; font-style:italic;font-size:200px') tooltip(#all) 
:: width=800, height=500

In this example, the labels for legend become so large that overlap with the visualization.
Current workaround is to use legends(none)

items.title: Issues with visualizing word clouds if multiple items are selected on the primary graph

milestone.description: Next interim release; the date is provisional

items.body:
For a dashboard composed from 2 related charts:
%%brunel data('topicsContent') bar x(topic) y(weight) color(weight) sort(weight) sum(weight) tooltip(#all) interaction(select) | 
interaction(filter)  cloud color(weight) size(weight) sort(weight) label(word)  
:: width=800, height=500

While using shift to choose multiple topics on the primary chart, Brunel shows an incorrect  word cloud visualization - the words of the second cloud are visualized as very small in comparison with the words of the first cloud.

items.title: Feature request: supporting custom maps in Brunel

milestone.description: This release will mainly be small fixes

items.body:
Currently Brunel supports great visualization for maps on the level of countries/states. However there is no support for very detailed maps like maps of boroughs in NYC. It would not make sense to load all possible variations in Brunel, but perhaps loading the custom maps and using them with Brunel would make perfect sense.

Here is an example of geojson for NYC boroughs:
https://github.com/dwillis/nyc-maps/blob/master/boroughs.geojson

items.title: Bar chart outside range of axis

milestone.description: This release will mainly be small fixes

items.body:
I don't know if this is related to the other issue regarding binning of timestamps. I minimised my input file to this set:
```
datetime,events        
2017-02-16T01:04:18,20 
2017-02-16T02:03:05,1  
2017-02-16T03:04:37,10 
2017-02-16T04:04:21,20 
2017-02-16T05:21:21,8  
2017-02-16T06:04:18,10 
2017-02-16T07:04:43,10 
2017-02-16T08:35:05,1  
2017-02-16T09:04:21,20 
2017-02-16T10:37:52,1  
2017-02-16T11:01:05,5  
2017-02-16T12:43:04,1  
2017-02-16T13:03:56,1  
2017-02-16T14:04:21,20
```
I used a statement like the following
`bar x(datetime) y(events:linear) sum(events)  tooltip(datetime,events)&width=400&height=200`
The width and height at the end are there because I use this in a browser window using the rest interface.
The resulting chart consists of mainly two peaks: one on 02AM and one on 03AM.
If I size and grab the chart, I can see there are also peaks more to the right.
If I remove the three last records from my input file, the graph collapses to a single bar that coincides with the y-axis, and the labels on the x-axis are gone.

items.title: Binning of date-time stamps

milestone.description: This release will mainly be small fixes

items.body:
I have a file that contains in each record a date  and time stamp like `2017-02-16,12:09:24`. For the issue on hand, it doesn't really seem to matter if I parse these together using pandas in jupyter, or if I just use the time. They are recognized as type `datetime64[ns]`. Because I have several thousand records, I want them to be binned in e.g. one hour slots. Binning works fine, were it not for the fact that AM and PM are binned together in one bin. So, these records are combined in the same bin:
`date,time,where,fielda,fieldb,fieldc,num_events
2017-02-16,00:00:16,AHJB,valuea1,valueb1,valuec1,10
2017-02-16,12:09:24,AHJB,valuea2,valueb2,valuec2,10`
such that for example
`bar x(datetime) y(num_events) sum(num_events) bin(datetime) tooltip(datetime,num_events)`
shows a single bar with num_events=20
Is there something I need to do?
Guus Bonnes

items.title: multiple interaction() commands stopped working in version 2.2 or later
Feature request: support 2 field filters from two different datasets in one chart
items.body:
Here is the sample syntax with two datasets --EdgeData.csv and NodeData.csv.

data(EdgeData.csv) edge  key(From, To)  sort(Weight) filter(Weight:[0.0, 1.0]) + data(NodeData.csv)  point x(LEVEL) y(POSITION) key(ID) filter(Importance:[0.0, 1.0]) 

The requirements are like this:
One filter(Weight:[0.0, 1.0]) is based on field "Weight" from EdgeData.csv and the other filter(Importance:[0.0, 1.0]) is based on field "Importance" from NodeData.csv.

items.title: Enhancement: handling rules as a chord diagram
items.body:
When displaying the rules (i.e. implying support for direction), it is possible to get rules that have different directions but based on the same categories. E.g.:
Camping equipment -> Outdoor protection with confidence 0.31
Outdoor protection -> Camping equipment with confidence 0.6

Brunel's cord diagram will display either first one or the second one depending on the sorting order in the data set. Some approach is needed to visualize the different associations, but related to the same categories.

items.title: Map of NY is not precise

milestone.description: This release will mainly be small fixes

items.body: Dear team! I am using the Brunel library to visualize a map of the New York city with points on it. Those points are, actually bike parking spots. Unfortunately on a map that Brunel produces points are not on the right places - some of them appear to be in the ocean, but obviously no bike parking is possible there. Is there a possibility solve this problem and visualize a precise map of the New York city (preferably with streets) using Brunel? Here is the code and how the map looks like: `%%brunel map('NY') + data('top_15_start') x(START_STATION_LONGITUDE) y(START_STATION_LATITUDE) title("Top-15 start stations") ` where the "top_15_start" is a Spark dataFrame with columns (START_STATION_LONGITUDE, START_STATION_LATITUDE) Hope you can help! :)

items.title: Feature request: provide a way to accept and use user defined "visInstance" name

milestone.description: This release will mainly be small fixes

items.body:
It is required that visInstance has its own unique name (eg: var v = new BrunelVis("visualization") when you have multiple charts in one page. 

Currently D3Builder#endVisSystem(VisItem main) uses hard codes name "v" for all the places which require "visInstance" name, such as line 381:
 controls.writeEventHandler(out, "v"); 

or line 387:
out.add("BrunelD3.animateBuild(v,",  .....

or line 390:
out.add("v.build(");

In our codes, in order to make multiple charts be displayed in one page, we are replacing "v" with our unique id. The codes are messy. 

The string replacement doesn't work in BrunelJQueryControlFactory .make_range_slider(...) any more because it has  "....v .data(null, 0).field( ..".

The best and cleanest solution is that Brunel to provide a way, such as in BuilderOptions.visInstanceName, for users to set vis instance name and Brunel use it to writes out the script.

items.title: Root node of tree diagram is defined as "leaf" type in version 2.2
items.body:

With the identical syntax and data, in version 2.1, the root element was defined as
